intro: Wokoia, commonly known as the golden wokoia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Wokoia is often found growing in shaded, moist environments along creeklines and in understorey vegetation. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of the region's biodiversity.
